docs.text: maybe this mission should have been scrubbed
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mission to mars
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a film review by michael redman copyright 2000 by michael redman
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's a world of difference between artists and technicians .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the artist has a vision to create something new .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he may not do it well , it might be sloppy , but it's something you've never seen before .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a good technician can make it look good , but without direction from his own inner artist or someone else , it's going to be just a xerox .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: obviously successful films need both skills .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: brian de palma is a masterful technician .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he's spent his career copying others , most notably hitchcock .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he usually knows exactly what to do to make a scene work , but only because he has learned it by rote .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: aside from rare flashes of originality , his films are often soul-dead .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in de palma's latest , he turns his attention to stanley kubrick .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to tell the truth , i enjoyed portions of this movie , but i liked it a lot better over 30 years ago when it was called " 2001 " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i enjoyed it even more when it was titled " close encounters " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: nasa has set its sights for mars .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when the first crew meets with disaster , a rescue mission is sent to the red planet .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they don't do so well either , but eventually meet up the lone surviving astronaut-gone-rasta and solve the mysteries of the universe .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and it's all so boring .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are so many scenes that just don't work , it's difficult to begin .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when the first crew is a few feet away from a raging massive upside-down martian tornado ( which looks remarkably like a sandworm from " dune " ) destroying everything in its path , they just hang out watching .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: error .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the most interesting character ( and that's not saying much ) is killed off .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: error .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the alien is laughable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: error .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the rest of the characters are the dullest people imaginable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: error .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's some nice eyecandy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the face on mars , which turns out to be a giant metal thai buddha head , looks cool .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a three-dimensional holographic planetarium is more fun to watch than anything at disney world .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: maneuvering in space suits outside the ship seems realistic .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but there's so much more that feels as if we've been there before .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: from " 2001 " , there's the rotating space station , the blinding white room .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: >from " close encounters " , they solve a sound puzzle and play it to the aliens .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the list goes on .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the actors are mostly mobile wooden statues .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even gary sinise and tim robbins can't muster enough emotion to convince us they are breathing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: no one seems to care about anything that happens .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you won't either .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the absolutely worst sin is the blatant product placement as dr . pepper , with a 20 foot tall logo , saves the day .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they should save the commercials for those insipid bits before the film .
docs.label: negative
